Now let me check the NAS (National Accounts Statistics) dataset, as gross fixed capital formation is a macroeconomic indicator:

Good! I found indicator_code 9 for "Gross Fixed Capital Formation". Now let me get the metadata to see what breakdown options are available:

Perfect! I can see that institutional_code 2 corresponds to "Private Non-Financial Corporations". Now let me fetch the data for 2020-21:

Based on the MoSPI data, here's the Gross Fixed Capital Formation by Private Non-Financial Corporations for 2020-21:

The data shows three different revision estimates:

The Third Revised Estimates are typically the most accurate and represent the final figures. So the gross fixed capital formation by private non-financial corporations in 2020-21 was approximately ₹19.21 lakh crore at current prices and ₹15.46 lakh crore at constant prices (base year 2011-12).

This data reflects private sector investment in fixed assets like machinery, equipment, buildings, and infrastructure during the financial year 2020-21, which was significantly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
